sense.name: express disagreement often angrily
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1 and NP2 ARGUE NP1 ARGUE with NP2 NP1[agent[plural]] ARGUE
sense.examples: These girls are always arguing about something. Kids, will you stop arguing with each other? They were arguing on which film to go and see.

sense.name: state an opinion, idea, or belief
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] ARGUE (NP2[patient]) NP1[agent] ARGUE SCOMP
sense.examples: They argued in favor of greater freedom. You could argue that this calls for greater freedom or not less. You can argue the case either way.

sense.name: indicate validity or truth of something
sense.examples: The increase in crime argued for tougher jail time. The evidence argues a change in policy. New findings argue for your claim. These results argue the need for more work.
